snippet: The impending American and NATO withdrawal has not only slashed military spending, but also dramatically reduced construction projects, stopping a building boom in its tracks.
abstract: Kabul Journal; impending American and NATO withdrawal from Afghanistan has not only slashed military spending there, but also dramatically reduced construction projects, stopping a building boom in its tracks; construction downturn is especially visible in Kabul, where heavy equipment businesses have fallen on hard times.

byline.original: By ROD NORDLAND and SANGAR RAHIMI

lead_paragraph: The impending American and NATO withdrawal has not only slashed military spending, but also dramatically reduced construction projects, stopping a building boom in its tracks.

headline.seo: As NATO Nears Exit, Afghan Construction Dries Up
headline.main: As NATO Nears Exit, Construction Dries Up
headline.print_headline: As NATO Nears Exit, Construction Dries Up
